mc.name: Volunteer Militia
mc.flavorText: After making the Peach Garden Oath, the three brothers raised an army of 500 youths to fight the Yellow Scarves rebellion.

mc.name: Wei Night Raiders
mc.oracleText:
Horsemanship
Whenever Wei Night Raiders deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card.
mc.printedText:
Horsemanship
When Wei Night Raiders successfully damages your opponent, he or she chooses and discards a card from his or her hand. (Ignore this effect if your opponent doesn't have any cards.)

mc.name: Wu Admiral
mc.oracleText: Wu Admiral gets +1/+1 as long as an opponent controls an Island.
mc.printedText: As long as your opponent has an island in play, Wu Admiral gets +1/+1.
mc.flavorText: The Wu kingdom's well-trained admirals were integral to the Southlands' victory at Red Cliffs as well as the kingdom's defense.

mc.name: Flanking Troops
mc.oracleText: Whenever Flanking Troops attacks, you may tap target creature.
mc.printedText: When Flanking Troops attacks, you may tap any one creature. (Tapped creatures can't block.)
mc.flavorText: Following the battle of Redcliffs, both Liu Bei and Sun Quan coveted the province of Jingzhou. After Sun Quan's troops failed to capture it, Liu Bei's succeeded.

mc.name: Alert Shu Infantry
mc.oracleText: Vigilance
mc.printedText: Attacking doesn't cause Alert Shu Infantry to tap.
mc.flavorText: Kongming's predecessor helped Liu Bei win the battle of Fancheng by recognizing and defeating Cao Ren's use of the dreaded "Eight Gold Locks" formation.

mc.name: Shu Soldier-Farmers
mc.oracleText: When Shu Soldier-Farmers comes into play, you gain 4 life.
mc.printedText: When Shu Soldier-Farmers comes into play, you gain 4 life.
mc.flavorText: During Kongming's campaigns against the Wei, his Shu troops rotated from the battlefront to the fields every hundred days.

mc.name: Shu Foot Soldiers
mc.flavorText: Liu Bei lost many men at the battle of Runan because of his lack of strategy. It wasn't until he met Kongming that the he began to truly succeed as a leader.

mc.name: Kongming, Sleeping Dragon
mc.oracleText: Other creatures you control get +1/+1.
mc.printedText: All your other creatures get +1/+1 as long as Kongming is in play.
mc.flavorText:
"Such a lord as this--all virtues' height--
Had never been, nor ever was again."

mc.name: Loyal Retainers
mc.oracleText: Sacrifice Loyal Retainers: Return target legendary creature card from your graveyard to play. Play this ability only during your turn, before the combat phase.
mc.printedText: On your turn, before you attack you may put Loyal Retainers in your graveyard to take any one Legend card from your graveyard and put that creature into play.

mc.name: Taunting Challenge
mc.oracleText: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.
mc.printedText: Choose any one creature. This turn, all creatures able to block it do so.
mc.flavorText: Incensed by their opponents' unrelenting taunts, even wise generals were known to rashly lead their troops into battle--often to disastrous defeats.

mc.name: Ambition's Cost
mc.oracleText: You draw three cards and you lose 3 life.
mc.printedText: Draw three cards. You lose 3 life.
mc.flavorText:
"When you give offense to heaven, to whom can you pray?"
--Cao Cao, quoting Confucius

mc.name: Guan Yu, Sainted Warrior
mc.oracleText:
Horsemanship
When Guan Yu, Sainted Warrior is put into your graveyard from play, you may shuffle Guan Yu into your library.
mc.printedText:
Horsemanship
When Guan Yu is put into your graveyard from play, you may shuffle Guan Yu into your library.

mc.name: Kongming's Contraptions
mc.oracleText: {T}: Kongming's Contraptions deals 2 damage to target attacking creature. Play this ability only during the declare attackers step, and only on an opponent's turn.
mc.printedText: After you're attacked, before you declare blockers, you may tap Kongming's Contraptions to have it deal 2 damage to any one attacking creature.

mc.name: Riding Red Hare
mc.oracleText: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains horsemanship until end of turn.
mc.printedText: Any one creature gets +3/+3 and gains horsemanship until the end of the turn.
mc.flavorText: One of the greatest steeds in the empire, Red Hare could travel a thousand li a day and climb hills as if running on flat ground.

mc.name: Shu Elite Companions
mc.oracleText: Horsemanship
mc.printedText: Horsemanship
mc.flavorText: Throughout the three kingdoms, important generals were often guarded by small groups of expert soldiers known as "elite companions."

mc.name: Wu Longbowman
mc.oracleText: {T}: Wu Longbowman deals 1 damage to target creature or player. Play this ability only during your turn, before the combat phase.
mc.printedText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Wu Longbowman to have it deal 1 damage to any one creature or player.

mc.name: Liu Bei, Lord of Shu
mc.oracleText:
Horsemanship
Liu Bei, Lord of Shu gets +2/+2 as long as you control a permanent named Guan Yu, Sainted Warrior or a permanent named Zhang Fei, Fierce Warrior.
mc.printedText:
Horsemanship
As long as you have Guan Yu and/or Zhang Fei in play, Liu Bei gets +2/+2.
mc.flavorText:
"Only wisdom and virtue can truly win men's devotion."
--Liu Bei

mc.name: Ravages of War
mc.oracleText: Destroy all lands.
mc.printedText: Destroy all lands. (This includes your lands.)
mc.flavorText: "Thorn bushes spring up wherever the army has passed. Lean years follow in the wake of a great war."Lao Tzu, Tao Te Ching (trans. Feng and English)

mc.name: Red Cliffs Armada
mc.oracleText: Red Cliffs Armada can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
mc.printedText: Red Cliffs Armada can't attack unless the defending player has an island in play.
mc.flavorText: By the battle of Red Cliffs in the year 208, the Wu kingdom controlled more than 7,000 warships on the Yangtze.

mc.name: Shu General
mc.oracleText: Horsemanship, vigilance
mc.printedText:
Horsemanship
Attacking doesn't cause Shu General to tap.

mc.name: Meng Huo's Horde
mc.flavorText: Through his allies, Meng Huo commanded several hundred thousand troops composed of cavalry, rattan-armored warriors, infantry, naked men with swords, and wild animals.

mc.name: Empty City Ruse
mc.oracleText: Target opponent skips all combat phases of his or her next turn.
mc.printedText: Your opponent can't attack on his or her next turn.
mc.flavorText: Out of time and options, Kongming was forced to bluff at Xicheng. He tricked an army of 150,000 Wei by leaving the city gates open and calmly playing the zither.

mc.name: Forest Bear
mc.flavorText:
Fish and bear paws--one can't have both.
--Chinese idiom meaning
"you can't have it both ways"

mc.name: Zodiac Rooster
mc.oracleText: Plainswalk
mc.printedText: Plainswalk (If defending player has a plain in play, Zodiac Rooster can't be blocked.)
mc.flavorText: ". . . But the time of Han had run--could he Kongming not tell?-- / That night his master star fell past the hills. . . ."

mc.name: Blaze
mc.oracleText: Blaze deals X damage to target creature or player.
mc.printedText: Blaze deals X damage to any one creature or player.
mc.flavorText:
"Spreading flames illumined cloud and sea:
Cao Cao went down; 'twas Zhou Yu's victory."

mc.name: Stone Catapult
mc.oracleText: {T}: Destroy target tapped nonblack creature. Play this ability only during your turn, before the combat phase.
mc.printedText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Stone Catapult to destroy any one tapped creature that isn't black.

mc.name: False Defeat
mc.oracleText: Return target creature card from your graveyard to play.
mc.printedText: Take any one creature card from your graveyard and put that creature into play.
mc.flavorText:
"All warfare is based on deception."
--Sun Tzu, Art of War (trans. Giles)

mc.name: Zodiac Dragon
mc.oracleText: When Zodiac Dragon is put into your graveyard from play, you may return it to your hand.
mc.printedText: If Zodiac Dragon is put into your graveyard, you may return Zodiac Dragon to your hand.
mc.flavorText: ". . . The kingdoms three are now the stuff of dream, / For men to ponder, past all praise or blame."

mc.name: Wei Elite Companions
mc.oracleText: Horsemanship
mc.printedText: Horsemanship
mc.flavorText: Cao Cao was more concerned with capabilities than lineage. He excelled at recruiting and retaining men of talent to serve him.

mc.name: Desperate Charge
mc.oracleText: Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.
mc.printedText: All your creatures get +2/+0 until the end of the turn.
mc.flavorText: "Lieutenants dishonored, corpses carted home; The general raises troops again to take revenge."

mc.name: Sun Quan, Lord of Wu
mc.oracleText: Creatures you control have horsemanship.
mc.printedText: All your creatures gain horsemanship as long as Sun Quan is in play. (This includes Sun Quan.)
mc.flavorText: "One score and four he reigned, the Southland king: / A dragon coiled, a tiger poised below the mighty Yangtze."

mc.name: Coercion
mc.oracleText: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. Choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
mc.printedText: Look at your opponent's hand and choose a card from it. Your opponent discards that card.
mc.flavorText: Though he held the title of prime minister, Cao Cao used the emperor's name to exert his own influence on the empire.

mc.name: Imperial Edict
mc.oracleText: Target opponent sacrifices a creature.
mc.printedText: Your opponent chooses one of his or her creatures. Destroy that creature.
mc.flavorText: Frustrated with Cao Cao's control of the imperial court, Emperor Xian secretly issued an edict condemning him, using his own blood as ink.

mc.name: Yuan Shao, the Indecisive
mc.oracleText:
Horsemanship
Each creature you control can't be blocked by more than one creature.
mc.printedText:
Horsemanship
Each of your creatures can't be blocked by more than one creature each turn as long as Yuan Shao is in play.

mc.name: Wei Scout
mc.oracleText: Horsemanship
mc.printedText: Horsemanship
mc.flavorText:
He will win who, prepared himself, waits to take the enemy unprepared."
--Sun Tzu, Art of War (trans. Giles)

mc.name: Famine
mc.oracleText: Famine deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.
mc.printedText: Famine deals 3 damage to each creature and player. (This includes your creatures and you.)
mc.flavorText: "But it was a year of dearth. People were reduced to eating leaves of jujube trees. Corpses were seen everywhere in the countryside."

mc.name: Wei Infantry
mc.flavorText: Wei won the battle of Hefei when Zhang Liao defeated Sun Quan and then foiled a Wu scheme to incite rebellion.

mc.name: Zhang He, Wei General
mc.oracleText:
Horsemanship
Whenever Zhang He, Wei General attacks, each other creature you control gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
mc.printedText:
Horsemanship
When Zhang He attacks, all your other creatures get +1/+0 until the end of the turn.

mc.name: Overwhelming Forces
mc.oracleText: Destroy all creatures target opponent controls. Draw a card for each creature destroyed this way.
mc.printedText: Destroy all your opponent's creatures. you draw a card for each creature destroyed in this way.
mc.flavorText: By the year 208, Cao Cao commanded more than 1,000 experienced generals and a million infantry, cavalry, and naval troops.

mc.name: Wolf Pack
mc.oracleText: You may have Wolf Pack assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
mc.printedText: When Wolf Pack attacks and is blocked, you may have it deal its damage to the defending player instead of to the creatures blocking it.

mc.name: Heavy Fog
mc.oracleText:
Play Heavy Fog only during the declare attackers step and only if you are the defending player.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by attacking creatures.
mc.printedText:
Play Heavy Fog only after you're attacked, before you declare blockers.
This turn, all damage dealt to you by attacking creatures is reduced to 0.

mc.name: Sage's Knowledge
mc.oracleText: Return target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
mc.printedText: Return any one sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
mc.flavorText:
"Those who know do not talk. Those who talk do not know."
--Lao Tzu, Tao Te Ching
(trans. Feng and English)

mc.name: Zhou Yu, Chief Commander
mc.oracleText: Zhou Yu, Chief Commander can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
mc.printedText: Zhou Yu can't attack unless your opponent has an island in play.
mc.flavorText:
"After making me, Zhou Yu, did you have to make Kongming?"
--Zhou Yu crying to heaven on his deathbed

mc.name: Rolling Earthquake
mc.oracleText: Rolling Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without horsemanship and each player.
mc.printedText: Rolling Earthquake deals X damage to each player and each creature without horsemanship. (This includes you and your creatures without horsemanship.)

mc.name: Exhaustion
mc.oracleText: Creatures and lands target opponent controls don't untap during his or her next untap step.
mc.printedText: At the beginning of your opponent's next turn, he or she skips untapping creatures and lands.
mc.flavorText: Starving and worn, Cao Cao escaped from the battle of Red Cliffs with only 27 of his original 800,000 men.

mc.name: Extinguish
mc.oracleText: Counter target sorcery spell.
mc.printedText:
Play Extinguish only in response to another player playing a sorcery.
That sorcery has no effect, and that player puts it into his or her graveyard.

mc.name: Wu Spy
mc.oracleText: When Wu Spy comes into play, look at the top two cards of target player's library. Put one of them into his or her graveyard.
mc.printedText: When Wu Spy comes into play, look at the top two cards of any player's library. Put one of them on the top of that player's library and the other in his or her graveyard.

mc.name: Preemptive Strike
mc.oracleText: Counter target creature spell.
mc.printedText:
Play Preemptive Strike only in response to another player playing a creature card.
That creature has no effect, and that player puts it into his or her graveyard.

mc.name: Peach Garden Oath
mc.oracleText: You gain 2 life for each creature you control.
mc.printedText: For each creature you have in play, you gain 2 life.
mc.flavorText:
"We three, though of separate ancestry, join in brotherhood . . . . We dare not hope to be together always but hereby vow to die the selfsame day."
--Peach Garden Oath

mc.name: Forest
mc.oracleText: G
mc.printedText: G

mc.name: Cunning Advisor
mc.oracleText: {T}: Target opponent discards a card. Play this ability only during your turn, before the combat phase.
mc.printedText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Cunning Advisor to force your opponent to choose and discard a card from his or her hand.

mc.name: Zodiac Dog
mc.oracleText: Mountainwalk
mc.printedText: Mountainwalk (If defending player has a mountain in play, Zodiac Dog can't be blocked.)
mc.flavorText: ". . . Jiang Wei alone still strove with might and main: / Nine times more he fought the north--in vain. . . ."

mc.name: Fire Bowman
mc.oracleText: Sacrifice Fire Bowman: Fire Bowman deals 1 damage to target creature or player. Play this ability only during your turn, before the combat phase.
mc.printedText: On your turn, before you attack, you may destroy Fire Bowman to have it deal 1 damage to any one creature or player.

mc.name: Lu Bu, Master-at-Arms
mc.oracleText: Horsemanship, haste
mc.printedText:
Horsemanship
Lu Bu is unaffected by summoning sickness.
mc.flavorText: "Dong Zhuo's man, Lu Bu, warrior without peer, / Far surpassed the champions of his sphere."

mc.name: Yellow Scarves Cavalry
mc.oracleText:
Horsemanship
Yellow Scarves Cavalry can't block.
mc.printedText:
Horsemanship
Yellow Scarves Cavalry can't block.

mc.name: Control of the Court
mc.oracleText: Draw four cards, then discard three cards at random.
mc.printedText: Draw four cards and put them into your hand. Then discard three cards at random from your hand.
mc.flavorText: "Power-hungry eunuchs, the curse of the dynasty, have thrown the masses of the people into the depths of misery."

mc.name: Imperial Recruiter
mc.oracleText: When Imperial Recruiter comes into play, search your library for a creature card with power 2 or less, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
mc.printedText: When Imperial Recruiter comes into play, search your library for a creature card with power no greater than 2, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your library afterward.

mc.name: Zodiac Goat
mc.oracleText: Mountainwalk
mc.printedText: Mountainwalk (If defending player has a mountain in play, Zodiac Goat can't be blocked.)
mc.flavorText: ". . . Near death in Baidi, having reigned three years, / Bei sadly placed his son in Kongming's care. . . ."

mc.name: Independent Troops
mc.flavorText: "The empire, long united, must divide, and long divided, must unite."

mc.name: Yellow Scarves Troops
mc.oracleText: Yellow Scarves Troops can't block.
mc.printedText: Yellow Scarves Troops can't block.
mc.flavorText: Over 500,000 commoners followed Zhang Jue, General of Heaven, in his attempt to overthrow the corrupt Han dynasty.

mc.name: Eunuchs' Intrigues
mc.oracleText: Target opponent chooses a creature he or she controls. Other creatures he or she controls can't block this turn.
mc.printedText: Your opponent chooses one of his or her creatures. Only that creature can block this turn.
mc.flavorText: Taking control of powerful court positions one by one, eunuchs eventually brought on the fall of the Han dynasty, leading to the chaos of the Three Kingdoms.

mc.name: Diaochan, Artful Beauty
mc.oracleText: {T}: Destroy target creature of your choice, then destroy target creature of an opponent's choice. Play this ability only during your turn, before the combat phase.
mc.printedText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Diaochan to destroy any one creature. Then, your opponent destroys any one creature of his or her choice.

mc.name: Southern Elephant
mc.flavorText: While defending their southern borders, both the Wu and Shu kingdoms fought against the barbarians' trained elephants.

mc.name: Ghostly Visit
mc.oracleText: Destroy target nonblack creature.
mc.printedText: Destroy any one creature that isn't black.
mc.flavorText: Cao Cao was haunted to death by the ghosts of the empresses and other high courtiers he had murdered.

mc.name: Marshaling the Troops
mc.oracleText: Tap any number of untapped creatures you control. You gain 4 life for each creature tapped this way.
mc.printedText: Tap any number of your creatures. You gain 4 life for each creature tapped this way. (Tapped creatures can't block.)

mc.name: Cao Cao, Lord of Wei
mc.oracleText: {T}: Target opponent discards two cards. Play this ability only during your turn, before the combat phase.
mc.printedText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Cao Cao to force your opponent to choose and discard two cards from his or her hand. (If your opponent has only one card, he or she discards it.)

mc.name: Borrowing the East Wind
mc.oracleText: Borrowing the East Wind deals X damage to each creature with horsemanship and each player.
mc.printedText: Borrowing the East Wind deals X damage to each player and each creature with horsemanship. (This includes you and your creatures with horsemanship.)

mc.name: Stalking Tiger
mc.oracleText: Stalking Tiger can't be blocked by more than one creature.
mc.printedText: Stalking Tiger can't be blocked by more than one creature each turn.
mc.flavorText: Throughout Chinese history, generals have often been referred to as tigers for their fierceness, strength, and bravery.

mc.name: Island
mc.oracleText: U
mc.printedText: U

mc.name: Warrior's Oath
mc.oracleText: Take an extra turn after this one. At the end of that turn, you lose the game.
mc.printedText: Take another turn after this one. At the end of that turn, you lose the game. (You don't lose if you've already won.)
mc.flavorText:
"If I fail, my head is yours."
--Warrior's oath common
during the Three Kingdoms period

mc.name: Eightfold Maze
mc.oracleText:
Play Eightfold Maze only during the declare attackers step and only if you are the defending player.

Destroy target attacking creature.
mc.printedText:
Play Eightfold Maze only after you're attacked, before you declare blockers.
Destroy any one attacking creature.

mc.name: Stolen Grain
mc.oracleText: Stolen Grain deals 5 damage to target opponent. You gain 5 life.
mc.printedText: Stolen Grain deals 5 damage to your opponent. You gain 5 life.
mc.flavorText: At the battle of Guandu, Cao Cao defeated Yuan Shao by raiding his grain depot, leaving him with no way to feed his troops.

mc.name: Burning Fields
mc.oracleText: Burning Fields deals 5 damage to target opponent.
mc.printedText: Burning Fields deals 5 damage to your opponent.
mc.flavorText:
"In raiding and plundering, be like fire, in immovability like a mountain."
--Sun Tzu, Art of War (trans. Giles)

mc.name: Lone Wolf
mc.oracleText: You may have Lone Wolf assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
mc.printedText: When Lone Wolf attacks and is blocked, you may have it deal its damage to the defending player instead of to the creatures blocking it.

mc.name: Wei Ambush Force
mc.oracleText: Whenever Wei Ambush Force attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
mc.printedText: When Wei Ambush Force attacks, it gets +2/+0 until the end of the turn.
mc.flavorText: The battle of Puyang marked the beginning of the end for Lu Bu. He lost the city--and later his life--to Cao Cao.

mc.name: Zodiac Monkey
mc.oracleText: Forestwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
mc.printedText: Forestwalk (If defending player has a forest in play, Zodaic Monkey can't be blocked.)
mc.flavorText:
". . . By six offensives from the hills of Qi
Kongming sought to change Han's destiny. . . ."

mc.name: Yuan Shao's Infantry
mc.oracleText: Whenever Yuan Shao's Infantry attacks alone, Yuan Shao's Infantry is unblockable this combat.
mc.printedText: Whenever Yuan Shao's Infantry attacks and no other creatures do, Yuan Shao's Infantry can't be blocked.

mc.name: Deception
mc.oracleText: Target opponent discards two cards.
mc.printedText: Your opponent chooses and discards two cards from his or her hand. (If your opponent has only one card, he or she discards it.)
mc.flavorText: Believing they wrote the forged letter that had been stolen from Zhou Yu, Cao Cao rashly executed his two best admirals for treason.

mc.name: Wei Strike Force
mc.oracleText: Horsemanship
mc.printedText: Horsemanship
mc.flavorText: At the battle of Chang'an, Ma Chao defeated the two generals Cao Cao sent to guard the pass but was forced to flee when Cao Cao's trickery turned his own ally against him.

mc.name: Wielding the Green Dragon
mc.oracleText: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
mc.printedText: Any one creature gets +4/+4 until the end of the turn.
mc.flavorText: Named for the eastern part of the sky, the source of energy and renewal, Guan Yu's crescent-moon blade weighed over 100 pounds.

mc.name: Mountain
mc.oracleText: R
mc.printedText: R

mc.name: Zodiac Rat
mc.oracleText: Swampwalk
mc.printedText: Swampwalk (If defending player has a swamp in play, Zodiac Rat can't be blocked.)
mc.flavorText: " . . . Cao Pi, Cao Rui, Fang, Mao, and briefly, Huan-- / The Sima took the empire in their turn. . . ."

mc.name: Mystic Denial
mc.oracleText: Counter target creature or sorcery spell.
mc.printedText: Play Mystic Denial only in response to another player playing a creature or a sorcery. That card has no effect, and that player puts it into his or her graveyard.

mc.name: Spring of Eternal Peace
mc.oracleText: You gain 8 life.
mc.printedText: You gain 8 life.
mc.flavorText: Bathing in this spring could cure ailments of body and mind alike.

mc.name: Three Visits
mc.oracleText: Search your library for a Forest card and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.
mc.printedText: Search your library for a forest card and put that forest into play. Shuffle your library afterward.
mc.flavorText:
"Trying to meet a worthy man in the wrong way is as bad as closing the door on an invited guest."
--Mencius, a Chinese philosopher

mc.name: Taoist Hermit
mc.oracleText: Taoist Hermit can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.
mc.printedText: Whenever your opponent chooses a creature in play, he or she can't choose Taoist Hermit.
mc.flavorText: Taoists chose to be hermits for many reasons, but all shared one unchanging goal: to follow the Tao.

mc.name: Hua Tuo, Honored Physician
mc.oracleText: {T}: Put target creature card from your graveyard on top of your library. Play this ability only during your turn, before the combat phase.
mc.printedText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Hua Tuo to put any one creature card from your graveyard on the top of your library.

mc.name: Trained Jackal
mc.flavorText: To taunt a man into action, call him a coward. To insult him beyond forgiveness, call him a jackal.

mc.name: Hunting Cheetah
mc.oracleText: Whenever Hunting Cheetah deals damage to an opponent, you may search your library for a Forest card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
mc.printedText: When Hunting Cheetah successfully damages your opponent, you may search your library for a forest card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your library afterward.

mc.name: Trained Cheetah
mc.oracleText: Whenever Trained Cheetah becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
mc.printedText: When Trained Cheetah attacks and is blocked, it gets +1/+1 until the end of the turn.
mc.flavorText: "King Mulu's cheetahs came riding on the winds, charging, with fangs bared and claws flexed."

mc.name: Barbarian General
mc.oracleText: Horsemanship
mc.printedText: Horsemanship
mc.flavorText:
"Barbarian tribes with their rulers are inferior to Chinese states without them."
--Confucius, The Analects (trans. Lau)

mc.name: Renegade Troops
mc.oracleText: Haste
mc.printedText: Renegade Troops is unaffected by summoning sickness.
mc.flavorText: "Across the land rebellions seethed and swarmed / As vicious war lords swooped down on all sides."

mc.name: Yellow Scarves General
mc.oracleText:
Horsemanship
Yellow Scarves General can't block.
mc.printedText:
Horsemanship
Yellow Scarves General can't block.
mc.flavorText: Zhang Jue, leader of the Yellow Scarves rebellion, was a Taoist master and tutored his soldiers in those arts.

mc.name: Barbarian Horde
mc.flavorText: Only twenty years after the Sima clan united the empire, invading barbarians divided it again.

mc.name: Misfortune's Gain
mc.oracleText: Destroy target creature. Its owner gains 4 life.
mc.printedText: Destroy any one creature. That creature's owner gains 4 life.
mc.flavorText: The mourning families of commanders and generals were often given land, valuables, or money to compensate for their losses.

mc.name: Balance of Power
mc.oracleText: If target opponent has more cards in hand than you, draw cards equal to the difference.
mc.printedText: If you have fewer cards in your hand than your opponent does, you draw until you have the same number. (When you play Balance of Power it doesn't count as in your hand.)

mc.name: Plains
mc.oracleText: W
mc.printedText: W

mc.name: Zodiac Rabbit
mc.oracleText: Forestwalk
mc.printedText: Forestwalk (If defending player has a forest in play, Zodiac Hare can't be blocked.)
mc.flavorText: ". . . The world's affairs rush on, an endless stream; / A sky-told fate, infinite in reach, dooms all. . . ."

mc.name: Wei Assassins
mc.oracleText: When Wei Assassins comes into play, target opponent sacrifices a creature.
mc.printedText: When Wei Assassins comes into play, your opponent chooses one of his or her creatures. Destroy that creature. (Ignore this effect if your opponent has no creatures in play.)

mc.name: Young Wei Recruits
mc.oracleText: Young Wei Recruits can't block.
mc.printedText: Young Wei Recruits can't block.
mc.flavorText:
"To send the common people to war untrained is to throw them away."
--Confucius, The Analects (trans. Lau)

mc.name: Mountain Bandit
mc.oracleText: Haste
mc.printedText: Mountain Bandit is unaffected by summoning sickness.
mc.flavorText: Penniless and far from home, many former Yellow Scarves and other soldiers became bandits to survive.

mc.name: Zodiac Pig
mc.oracleText: Swampwalk
mc.printedText: Swampwalk (If defending player has a swamp in play, Zodiac Pig can't be blocked.)
mc.flavorText: ". . . Zhong Hui and Deng Ai next led armies west: / And to the Cao, Han's hills and streams now passed. . . ."

mc.name: Poison Arrow
mc.oracleText: Destroy target nonblack creature. You gain 3 life.
mc.printedText: Destroy any one creature that isn't black. You gain 3 life.
mc.flavorText: In ancient China, not wearing armor could be a fatal mistake. Guan Yu, Zhou Yu, Sun Ce, and other heros were struck by poison arrows.

mc.name: Return to Battle
mc.oracleText: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
mc.printedText: Return any one creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
mc.flavorText: "Swallowing his eye, the valiant Xiahou Dun fought on; / But Cao Cao's vanguard, its commander wounded, could not hold out for long."

mc.name: Rally the Troops
mc.oracleText:
Play Rally the Troops only during the declare attackers step and only if you are the defending player.
Untap all creatures you control.
mc.printedText:
Play Rally the Troops only after you're attacked, before you declare blockers.
Untap all your creatures.

mc.name: Xiahou Dun, the One-Eyed
mc.oracleText:
Horsemanship
Sacrifice Xiahou Dun, the One-Eyed: Return target black card from your graveyard to your hand. Play this ability only during your turn, before the combat phase.
mc.printedText:
Horsemanship
On your turn, before you attack, you may put Xiahou Dun into your graveyard to return a black card from your graveyard to your hand.

mc.name: Slashing Tiger
mc.oracleText: Whenever Slashing Tiger becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
mc.printedText: When Slashing Tiger attacks and is blocked, it gets +2/+2 until the end of the turn.
mc.flavorText:
"Unless you enter the tiger's lair, you cannot get hold of the tiger's cubs."
--Sun Tzu, Art of War (trans. Giles)

mc.name: Relentless Assault
mc.oracleText: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
mc.printedText: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. You may declare an additional attack this turn.
mc.flavorText: With only 70,000 men under his command at the battle of Guandu, Cao Cao was able to defeat Yuan Shao and his 700,000.

mc.name: Champion's Victory
mc.oracleText:
Play Champion's Victory only during the declare attackers step and only if you are the defending player.
Return target attacking creature to its owner's hand.
mc.printedText:
Play Champion's Victory only after you're attacked, before you declare blockers.
Return any one attacking creature to its owner's hand.

mc.name: Zodiac Tiger
mc.oracleText: Forestwalk
mc.printedText: Forestwalk (If defending player has a forest in play, Zodiac Tiger can't be blocked.)
mc.flavorText: ". . . Three kings no more--Chenliu, Guiming, Anle. / The fiefs and posts must now be filled anew. . . ."

mc.name: Corrupt Court Official
mc.oracleText: When Corrupt Court Official comes into play, target opponent discards a card.
mc.printedText: When Corrupt Official comes into play, your opponent chooses and discards a card from his or her hand. (Ignore this effect if your opponent doesn't have any cards.)

mc.name: Virtuous Charge
mc.oracleText: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
mc.printedText: All your creatures get +1/+1 until the end of the turn.
mc.flavorText: "The empire belongs to no one man but to all in the empire. He who has virtue shall possess it."

mc.name: Guan Yu's 1,000-Li March
mc.oracleText: Destroy all tapped creatures.
mc.printedText: Destroy all tapped creatures. (This includes your tapped creatures.)
mc.flavorText: "He Guan Yu covered the ground on a thousand-li horse; / With dragon blade he took each pass by force."

mc.name: Zodiac Horse
mc.oracleText: Islandwalk
mc.printedText: Islandwalk (If defending player has an island in play, Zodiac Horse can't be blocked.)
mc.flavorText: ". . . --'First take Jingzhou, next the Riverlands; / On that rich region, base your own royal stand.' . . ."

mc.name: False Mourning
mc.oracleText: Put target card from your graveyard on top of your library.
mc.printedText: Take any one card from your graveyard and put that card on the top of your library.
mc.flavorText: Zhou Yu, Sun Ce, and other famous generals feigned their deaths in order to later surprise their opponents.

mc.name: Wu Infantry
mc.flavorText: The first battle of Hefei was Sun Quan's last as a field general. From then on he let his generals command in the field while he directed battle from behind the front lines.

mc.name: Council of Advisors
mc.oracleText: When Council of Advisors comes into play, draw a card.
mc.printedText: When Council of Advisors comes into play, draw a card.
mc.flavorText: Sun Quan's long and successful rule in the years 199 to 251 was due to his ability to choose and foster talented advisors and generals.

mc.name: Strategic Planning
mc.oracleText: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
mc.printedText: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
mc.flavorText: "Plans evolved within the tent decide a victory 1,000 li away."

mc.name: Rockslide Ambush
mc.oracleText: Rockslide Ambush deals damage equal to the number of Mountains you control to target creature.
mc.printedText: Rockslide Ambush deals to any one creature damage equal to the number of mountain cards you have in play. (This includes both tapped and untapped mountain cards.)

mc.name: Zhang Fei, Fierce Warrior
mc.oracleText: Horsemanship, vigilance
mc.printedText:
Horsemanship
Attacking doesn't cause Zhang Fei to tap.
mc.flavorText: Zhang Fei's uncharacteristic alliance with a defeated Riverlands general, Yan Yan, allowed Shu forces to advance through forty-five Riverlands strongpoints with no casualties.

mc.name: Wu Warship
mc.oracleText: Wu Warship can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
mc.printedText: Wu Warship can't attack unless the defending player has an island in play.
mc.flavorText: Both Wu and Wei warships patrolled the Yangtze River, the natural border between the two kingdoms.

mc.name: Stone Rain
mc.oracleText: Destroy target land.
mc.printedText: Destroy any one land.
mc.flavorText: Soldiers often blocked off the steep mountain passes to ambush enemy troops in western and central China.

mc.name: Swamp
mc.oracleText: B
mc.printedText: B

mc.name: Zodiac Snake
mc.oracleText: Swampwalk
mc.printedText: Swampwalk (If defending player has a swamp in play, Zodiac Snake can't be blocked.)
mc.flavorText: "Thrice Xuande's ardent quest led to Nanyang, / Where Sleeping Dragon unveiled Han's partition: . . ."

mc.name: Lady Zhurong, Warrior Queen
mc.oracleText: Horsemanship
mc.printedText: Horsemanship
mc.flavorText:
"A man, and such a fool I, a woman, will fight them for you."
--Lady Zhurong to her husband Meng Huo, before leading an army against the Shu

mc.name: Zuo Ci, the Mocking Sage
mc.oracleText:
Zuo Ci, the Mocking Sage can't be blocked by creatures with horsemanship.
Zuo Ci can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.
mc.printedText:
Zuo Ci can't be blocked by creatures with horsemanship.
Whenever your opponent chooses a creature in play, he or she can't choose Zuo Ci.

mc.name: Wu Elite Cavalry
mc.oracleText: Horsemanship
mc.printedText: Horsemanship
mc.flavorText: At the second battle of Ruxu, the brave Wu general Gan Ning raided Cao Cao's camp of 400,000 men with only 100 cavalry. Not a single man or horse was lost.

mc.name: Wu Scout
mc.oracleText:
Horsemanship
When Wu Scout comes into play, look at target opponent's hand.
mc.printedText:
Horsemanship
When Wu Scout comes into play, look at your opponent's hand.

mc.name: Straw Soldiers
mc.flavorText: The overnight appearance of miles of "armed" Wu forts at Guangling frightened a much vaster Wei force into fleeing for their lives.

mc.name: Lu Su, Wu Advisor
mc.oracleText: {T}: Draw a card. Play this ability only during your turn, before the combat phase.
mc.printedText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Lu Su to draw a card.
mc.flavorText: Lu Su served as an intermediary between the Wu and Shu kingdoms until Zhou Yu's death in 210, when he became Wu's supreme commander.

mc.name: Wu Light Cavalry
mc.oracleText: Horsemanship
mc.printedText: Horsemanship
mc.flavorText: A cunning strategist, Cao Ren tricked Zhou Yu by letting him enter Nanjun. Zhou Yu thought he was capturing the city until Cao Ren's arrows rained down upon him.

mc.name: Lu Xun, Scholar General
mc.oracleText:
Horsemanship
Whenever Lu Xun, Scholar General deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.
mc.printedText:
Horsemanship
When Lu Xun successfully damages your opponent, you may draw a card.

mc.name: Shu Grain Caravan
mc.oracleText: When Shu Grain Caravan comes into play, you gain 2 life.
mc.printedText: When Shu Grain Caravan comes into play, you gain 2 life.
mc.flavorText: Keeping a million-man army fed was no easy task. Grain and rice caravans were the lifeblood of the empire.

mc.name: Shu Farmer
mc.oracleText: {T}: You gain 1 life. Play this ability only during your turn, before the combat phase.
mc.printedText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Shu Farmer to gain 1 life.
mc.flavorText:
"The common folk are ceaselessly active. The fields are fertile and the soil productive, and neither flood nor drought plagues us."
--A Shu diplomat

mc.name: Capture of Jingzhou
mc.oracleText: Take an extra turn after this one.
mc.printedText: You take another turn after this one.
mc.flavorText: The province of Jingzhou was the fulcrum of the three kingdoms. At separate times it was coveted and controlled by the Wu, the Shu, and the Wei.

mc.name: Borrowing 100,000 Arrows
mc.oracleText: Draw a card for each tapped creature target opponent controls.
mc.printedText: For each tapped creature your opponent has in play, you draw a card.
mc.flavorText: Kongming and Lu Su tricked Wei troops into shooting over 100,000 arrows at them to later use against the Wei at Red Cliffs.

mc.name: Broken Dam
mc.oracleText: Tap one or two target creatures without horsemanship.
mc.printedText: Tap any one or two creatures without horsemanship. (Tapped creatures can't block.)
mc.flavorText: Using nature to their advantage, wise Three Kingdoms generals often let dammed rivers loose to destroy their enemies.

mc.name: Forced Retreat
mc.oracleText: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
mc.printedText: Return any one creature from play to the top of its owner's library.
mc.flavorText:
"Leadership, not numbers, determines victory."
--A Wu commander, before his 5,000 troops forced 15,000 Wei troops to retreat from Ruxu

mc.name: Brilliant Plan
mc.oracleText: Draw three cards.
mc.printedText: Draw three cards.
mc.flavorText: At Red Cliffs, Kongming and Zhou Yu each wrote his plan for defeating Wei on the palm of his hand. They laughed as they both revealed the same word, "Fire."

mc.name: Shu Defender
mc.oracleText: Whenever Shu Defender blocks, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
mc.printedText: When Shu Defender blocks, it gets +0/+2 until the end of the turn.
mc.flavorText: Confronting Cao Cao's army at Steepslope Bridge, Zhang Fei bellowed, "I am Zhang Fei of Yan Who dares fight me to the death?" Cao Cao's army cowered and fled.

mc.name: Trip Wire
mc.oracleText: Destroy target creature with horsemanship.
mc.printedText: Destroy any one creature with horsemanship.
mc.flavorText: Trip wire, hooked poles, and sunken pits were commonly used to unhorse riders during the Three Kingdoms period.

mc.name: Desert Sandstorm
mc.oracleText: Desert Sandstorm deals 1 damage to each creature.
mc.printedText: Desert Sandstorm deals 1 damage to each creature. (This includes your creatures.)
mc.flavorText: While pursuing the remnants of Yuan Shao's forces into the Wuhan Desert, Cao Cao was temporarily turned back by a fierce sandstorm.

mc.name: Shu Elite Infantry
mc.flavorText: Kongming's first campaign against the Wei kingdom was a rousing success until an arrogant Shu general, Ma Su, foolishly lost the city of Jieting.

mc.name: Counterintelligence
mc.oracleText: Return one or two target creatures to their owner's hand.
mc.printedText: Return any one or two creatures to their owner's hand.
mc.flavorText: Before the battle of Red Cliffs, a supposedly sleeping Zhou Yu allowed his old friend, a Wei advisor, to steal a planted letter forged as if from Wei's two best admirals.

mc.name: Spoils of Victory
mc.oracleText: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.
mc.printedText: Search your library for a plains, island, swamp, mountain, or forest card and put that land into play. Shuffle your library afterward.

mc.name: Sima Yi, Wei Field Marshal
mc.oracleText: Sima Yi, Wei Field Marshal's power is equal to the number of Swamps you control.
mc.printedText: Sima Yi has power equal to the number of swamp cards you have in play. (This includes both tapped and untapped swamp cards.)
mc.flavorText: Sima Yi fought for four generations of the Cao family before his own grandson became emperor and united the three kingdoms.

mc.name: Vengeance
mc.oracleText: Destroy target tapped creature.
mc.printedText: Destroy any one tapped creature.
mc.flavorText:
"Until I've gnawed their flesh and exterminated their clans, my humiliation will not be effaced."
--Liu Bei, on the death of
his oath-brother Guan Yu

mc.name: Fire Ambush
mc.oracleText: Fire Ambush deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
mc.printedText: Fire Ambush deals 3 damage to any one creature or player.
mc.flavorText: "With fire he broke the battle at Bowang . . . . Striking fear deep into Cao Cao's soul, thus Kongming scored a coup at his debut."

mc.name: Warrior's Stand
mc.oracleText:
Play Warrior's Stand only during the declare attackers step and only if you are the defending player.

Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.
mc.printedText:
Play Warrior's Stand only after you're attacked, before you declare blockers.
All your creatures get +2/+2 until the end of the turn.

mc.name: Shu Cavalry
mc.oracleText: Horsemanship
mc.printedText: Horsemanship
mc.flavorText: In establishing the Shu kingdom, Liu Bei's forces fought against Ma Chao at Chengdu. Eventually, Ma Chao surrendered and became one of Liu Bei's Tiger Generals.

mc.name: Zodiac Ox
mc.oracleText: Swampwalk
mc.printedText: Swampwalk (If defending player has a swamp in play, Zodiac Ox can't be blocked.)
mc.flavorText: ". . . Cao's abdication changed the face of all; / No mighty battles marked the Southland's fall. . . ."

mc.name: Burning of Xinye
mc.oracleText: Each player sacrifices four lands. Burning of Xinye deals 4 damage to each creature.
mc.printedText: You destroy four of your lands and your opponent destroys four of his or her lands. Then Burning of Xinye deals 4 damage to each creature. (This includes your creatures.)

mc.name: Forest
mc.oracleText: G
mc.printedText: G

mc.name: Forest
mc.oracleText: G
mc.printedText: G

mc.name: Island
mc.oracleText: U
mc.printedText: U

mc.name: Island
mc.oracleText: U
mc.printedText: U

mc.name: Mountain
mc.oracleText: R
mc.printedText: R

mc.name: Mountain
mc.oracleText: R
mc.printedText: R

mc.name: Plains
mc.oracleText: W
mc.printedText: W

mc.name: Plains
mc.oracleText: W
mc.printedText: W

mc.name: Swamp
mc.oracleText: B
mc.printedText: B

mc.name: Swamp
mc.oracleText: B
mc.printedText: B

mc.name: Zhao Zilong, Tiger General
mc.oracleText:
Horsemanship
Whenever Zhao Zilong, Tiger General blocks, it gets +1/+1 until the end of the turn.
mc.printedText:
Horsemanship
When Zhao Zilong blocks, it gets +1/+1 until the end of the turn.
mc.flavorText: Zhao Zilong was a brave and noble warrior. He twice rescued Liu Bei's son and heir, Liu Shan.

mc.name: Sun Ce, Young Conquerer
mc.oracleText:
Horsemanship
When Sun Ce, Young Conquerer comes into play, you may return target creature to its owner's hand.
mc.printedText:
Horsemanship
When Sun Ce comes into play, you may return any one creature from play to its owner's hand.

mc.name: Lu Meng, Wu General
mc.oracleText: Horsemanship
mc.printedText: Horsemanship
mc.flavorText: As the Wu chief commander, Lu Meng conquered Shu-held Jingzhou in 219 by disguising soldiers as merchants on boats filled with hiding troops.

mc.name: Zhuge Jin, Wu Strategist
mc.oracleText: {T}: Target creature is unblockable this turn. Play this ability only during your turn, before the combat phase.
mc.printedText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Zhuge Jin to make any one creature unblockable this turn.
mc.flavorText: When Zhuge Jin proposed the marriage of Guan Yu's daugher and Sun Quan's heir, Guan Yu's arrogant refusal led to disaster.

mc.name: Cao Ren, Wei Commander
mc.oracleText:
Horsemanship
When Cao Ren, Wei Commander comes into play, you lose 3 life.
mc.printedText:
Horsemanship
When Cao Ren comes into play, you lose 3 life.
mc.flavorText: Cao Cao's cousin, Cao Ren was known throughout the three kingdoms as the fiercest of warriors.

mc.name: Pang Tong, Young Phoenix
mc.oracleText: {T}: Target creature gets +0/+2 until end of turn. Play this ability only during your turn, before the combat phase.
mc.printedText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Pang Tong to give any one creature +0/+2 until the end of the turn.
mc.flavorText:
". . . It was Pang Tong's boat-connecting scheme
That let Zhou Yu accomplish his great deed."

mc.name: Huang Zhong, Shu General
mc.oracleText: Huang Zhong, Shu General can't be blocked by more than one creature.
mc.printedText: Huang Zhong can't be blocked by more than one creature each turn.
mc.flavorText:
"Virile in war, he kept the north in fear;
His prodigies subdued the western sphere."

mc.name: Lady Sun
mc.oracleText: {T}: Return Lady Sun and another target creature to their owners' hands. Play this ability only during your turn, before the combat phase.
mc.printedText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Lady Sun to return it and any one other creature to their owners' hands.
mc.flavorText: Sister to Sun Quan and wife to Liu Bei, Lady Sun often felt her loyalty to both tested.

mc.name: Zhang Liao, Hero of Hefei
mc.oracleText: Whenever Zhang Liao, Hero of Hefei deals damage to an opponent, that opponent discards a card.
mc.printedText: When Zhang Liao successfully damages your opponent, he or she chooses and discard a card from his or her hand. (Ignore this effect if your opponent doesn't have any cards.)

mc.name: Imperial Seal
mc.oracleText: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.
mc.printedText: Search your library for any one card. Shuffle your library and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.
mc.flavorText: "If Heaven has placed it in your hands, it means that the throne is destined to be yours."

mc.name: Ma Chao, Western Warrior
mc.oracleText:
Horsemanship
Whenever Ma Chao, Western Warrior attacks alone, it is unblockable this combat.
mc.printedText:
Horsemanship
Whenever Ma Chao attacks and no other creatures do, Ma Chao can't be blocked.

mc.name: Dong Zhou, the Tyrant
mc.oracleText: When Dong Zhou, the Tyrant comes into play, target creature an opponent controls deals damage equal to its power to that player.
mc.printedText: When Dong Zhou comes into play, choose one of your opponent's creatures. That creature deals damage to him or her equal to its power. (Ignore this effect if your opponent doesn't have any creatures in play.)

mc.name: Riding the Dilu Horse
mc.oracleText: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains horsemanship. (This effect does not end at end of turn)
mc.printedText: Any one creature gets +2/+2 and gains horsemanship.
mc.flavorText:
"All men have their appointed time; that's something no horse can change."
--Liu Bei, after being told that the
Dilu brings its master ill fortune

mc.name: Meng Huo, Barbarian King
mc.oracleText: Other green creatures you control get +1/+1.
mc.printedText: All your other green creatures get +1/+1 as long as Meng Huo is in play.
mc.flavorText: The stubborn Meng Huo was captured and released by Kongming seven times before finally surrendering.

mc.name: Taoist Mystic
mc.oracleText: Taoist Mystic can't be blocked by creatures with horsemanship.
mc.printedText: Taoist Mystic can't be blocked by creatures with horsemanship.
mc.flavorText: By appearing in places miles apart at the same time, Zuo Ci exhibited the mystic's ability to "shrink the land."

mc.name: Corrupt Eunuchs
mc.oracleText: When Corrupt Eunuchs comes into play, it deals 2 damage to target creature.
mc.printedText: When Corrupt Eunuchs comes into play, it deals 2 damage to any one creature. (If you're the only one with creatures, deal the damage to one of them.)

mc.name: Ravaging Horde
mc.oracleText: When Ravaging Horde comes into play, destroy target land.
mc.printedText: When Ravaging Horde comes into play, destroy any one land.
mc.flavorText: Upon his return to the capitol after taking soldiers to loot a nearby peaceful town, the prime minister, Dong Zhou, boasted of it as a victory over bandits.

mc.name: Xun Yu, Wei Advisor
mc.oracleText: {T}: Target creature you control gets +2/+0 until end of turn. Play this ability only during your turn, before the combat phase.
mc.printedText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Xun Yu to give one of your creatures +2/+0 until the end of the turn.
mc.flavorText: "A splendid talent, admired of all men His folly lay in serving Cao Cao's power."
